item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 24th October
item.description:
FAO GCC Highways and Flood Management and TBC Planning Enforcement and Flood Management CC Hucclecote PC and Chris Utley at SDC Greetings I was out walking yesterday morning and observed the flooding of part of Lobeleys Drive (adjacent to 2 Hazel Way and junction of Sycamore Walk) illustrated on attached map. Whilst this did not cause flooding to adjacent housing it illustrates a significant weakness in flood risk management at Coopers Edge and I would therefore urge that the relevant flood risk management authorities need to review the situation and work with the developers to put in effective mitigation. Given the I would therefore appreciate to know which person will be taking the lead on investigating this matter. I think it would also be useful to know if there is a single document that records the management of flood risk for the streams etc through Coopers Edge as this is an area with complex local authority boundaries (even to the extent that the area is covered by two police neighbourhood teams). Given that at some point the developers will step away it is also vital to have reassurance that long term management are sustainable. I have copied in Chris Utley at Stroud as a more significant flooding incident could also affect properties in the Stroud part of the development and some of mitigations to reduce flood risk are likely to require works within Stroud District. Kind regards Chas Townley Email: chastownley@myphone.coop 33 Chestnut Road, Coopers Edge, Brockworth, Gloucester, GL3 4GW Mobile: 07969275231
Report on FixMyStreet

hit a large pothole that caused a flat tyre
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 24th October
item.description:
Much of the double yellow lines are worn out or obscured by poor drainage etc. A particular problem area is immediately along the drop kerb (now damaged by the Plane tree!) which is access to a gravel drive serving 7 properties. It is regularly being block by vehicles, particularly in the dark as there is little or no road markings to help. Ideally a road marking of "Keep Clear" would probably sort the issue out as drivers would know there was constant access required.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Path misused by unlawful users problem, 24th October
item.description:
Reporting:path_misused_by_unlawful_users People are driving directly on to the A40, by the FrogMill bus stop, from the old road running at the back of the FrogMill pub. Who knows why, but it is destructive and dangerous. This is a public footpath, but not a road or even a bridleway.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 24th October
item.description:
Dear Sir/madam/team On Saturday 21st October a huge pot hole just near the entrance to the tennis club on old Bath road, took a large chunk out of my front near side tyre. I would like to claim compensation for yet my 3rd tyre in 6 months, prior to which I have not claimed for!! This is getting ridiculous now, as it’s costing a fortune, as here in Gloucestershire we have the worst roads in the country. Please respond. Regards Maggie Davis CLAIM FORM EMAILED ON REF 11441079
Report on FixMyStreet

Unfortunately have no house number. USRN 6700522 Many thanks
